name: Lime Pickle
history: Lime Pickle, known as 'Nimbu ka Achaar' in Hindi, is a traditional Indian condiment. It's made by pickling limes in a mix of spices, salt, and oil, sometimes with the addition of other flavorings like garlic or ginger.
description: Lime Pickle is a tangy and spicy Indian pickle made from whole or cut limes preserved in a blend of aromatic spices, salt, and oil. It's a staple in many Indian households and is enjoyed for its zesty and bold flavors.

instructions.title: Prepare the Limes
instructions.description: Wash the limes and dry them thoroughly. Quarter the limes, removing any seeds.

instructions.title: Mix with Spices
instructions.description: In a large bowl, mix the quartered limes with salt, red chili powder, mustard seeds powder, fenugreek seeds powder, asafoetida, and turmeric powder. Ensure the limes are well coated with the spices.

instructions.title: Add Oil
instructions.description: Pour mustard oil over the spiced limes. Mix well so that all the pieces are coated with the oil and spices.

instructions.title: Store the Pickle
instructions.description: Transfer the lime mixture to a clean, dry jar. Seal the jar tightly. Keep the jar in a sunny place for about 10-15 days, shaking it occasionally for the flavors to develop.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Once the pickle has matured and the limes have softened, it's ready to be served as a condiment with meals.

tips: Ensure the limes are completely dry before cutting to prevent spoilage.
The pickle's flavor enhances over time; the longer it sits, the better it tastes.
variations: Add garlic or ginger slices for additional flavors.
Experiment with different spice levels to suit your taste.

storage.shelfLife: Can be stored for up to a year in a cool, dry place.
storage.instructions: Use a dry, clean spoon for serving. Keep the jar tightly closed.

presentationTips: Serve in a small bowl or directly from the jar.
Pair with a platter of Indian bread and curries for a complete meal.
